conclusion: Shadows are cast away from the object in the direction opposite to the light source.

If the light source moves to the right, the shadows will shift to the left.
The size of the shadows depends on the angle between the light rays and the surface upon which the shadow is cast.
When the light source moves closer to being parallel with the surface, the shadows become longer.
When the light source moves more perpendicular to the surface, the shadows become shorter.

When the light source moves to the back right, Shadow A will be cast further to the left and become longer.
When the light source moves to the back right, Shadow B will shift further to the left and become longer.
When the light source moves to the back right, Shadow C will move to the left and become longer.
When the light source moves to the back right, Shadow D will shift to the left and become longer.
